Hi,

I'm trying to replace some Chemkin calls within a previously developed=

code with the corresponding Cantera calls.  I came across something
that I=
 can't explain other than that there might be something odd
going on inside=
 the intEnergy_mass call.  I'm trying to calculate the
following energy val=
ues:  Enthalpy (enthalpy_mass), Entropy
(entropy_mass), Internal (intEnergy=
_mass), Gibbs (gibbs_mass), and
Helmholtz.  There is currently (as far as I=
 could find) not a call to
calculate the Helmholtz energy.  I just used the=
 other values to
calculate it myself.    I'm using calculated Temperature a=
nd Species
fraction profiles across a given domain at several discrete poin=
ts. 
At each node, I am setting the state with the setState_TPY call to
Can=
tera.  On the first node (ie. first calls to the energy functions
in my cod=
e) it seems to do fine.  Successive calls to the energy
functions at each s=
uccesive node, however, return NAN (Enthalpy,
Entropy, Internal, and Gibbs)=
.  After messing around with it for a
bit, I found out that if I didn't cal=
l the intEnergy_mass function,
that everything calculates just fine.  I dou=
ble checked the values
that I was passing to the setState_TPY function and =
everything was
correct (valid numbers, no negative mass fractions, etc).  T=
he only
thing that I can figure is that there is something awry with the
in=
tEnergy_mass call.  If someone else can verify this and it leads to
a bug f=
ix, great.  If not, then I'll chalk it up to the little imp
named Murphy wh=
o sits upon my shoulder each day, and calculate U
directly myself.  Thanks.=


Dan Smyth
